title: Get Default Profile
name: Get_Default_Profile
description: Get the default ingest profile for the account.

examples.title: Get Default Profile Example:
examples.content: https://ingestion.api.brightcove.com/v1/accounts/57838016001/configuration

Response Fields.description: Video Cloud account id
configuration id
profile name for video-on-demand
default profile name for live streams
when the profile was created (epoch time in milliseconds)
when the profile was last modified (epoch time in milliseconds)
maximum number of custom profiles for the account
maximum number of renditions per profile
system-managed version number

examples.title: Success Response:
examples.content:
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
{
    "account_id": 57838016001,
    "date_created": 1442409154636,
    "date_last_modified": 1442409154636,
    "default_live_profile_id": "Live - Standard",
    "default_profile_id": "screencast-1280",
    "id": "55525f84e4b08e946aa03281",
    "max_profile_count": 10,
    "max_rendition_count": 20,
    "version": 1442409154636
}

Error 4xx.description: 401: Credentials are required to access this resource
404: The api couldn't find the resource you requested

examples.title: 409 Error Response
404 Error Response
examples.content:
HTTP/1.1 404 NOT_FOUND Error 404 NOT_FOUND

HTTP ERROR 404

Problem accessing /v1/accounts/57838016001/configurtion. Reason: 

 NOT_FOUND

title: Set Default Profile
name: Set_Default_Profile
description: Sets an ingest profile as the default for the account.

Request Body Fields.description: Video Cloud account ID
The id or name of the profile you want to set as the default
The id or name of the live profile you want to set as the default

examples.title: Set Default Profile Example:

Response Fields.description: Video Cloud account id
configuration id
profile name for video-on-demand
default profile name for live streams
when the profile was created (epoch time in milliseconds)
when the profile was last modified (epoch time in milliseconds)
maximum number of custom profiles for the account
maximum number of renditions per profile
system-managed version number

examples.title: Success Response:
examples.content:
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
{
    "account_id": 57838016001,
    "date_created": 1443727850896,
    "date_last_modified": 1443727850896,
    "default_live_profile_id": "Live - Standard",
    "default_profile_id": "high-resolution",
    "id": "55525f84e4b08e946aa03281",
    "max_profile_count": 10,
    "max_rendition_count": 20,
    "version": 1443727850896
}

Error 4xx.description: 401: Credentials are required to access this resource.
404: The api couldn't find the resource you requested
400: The JSON was not valid
409: Account configuration already exists for 57838016001; please delete the configuration first, or update it instead.

title: Update Default Profile

examples.title: 409 CONFLICT

title: Create Ingest Profile
name: Create_Ingest_Profile
description: Create a custom ingest profile for the account. Note that you can also do this through Brightcove Studio

Request Body Fields.description: profile name (must be unique within the account)
Video Cloud account ID.
description of the profile
whether Video Cloud should keep a copy of the renditions or delete them after pushing them to the CDN
array of rendition maps
how to handle mismatch between source and rendition aspect ratio
audio bitrate in kbps
number of audio channels
audio codec, e.g. aac
max aaic profile - aac-lc is the recommended value
whether to use constant bitrate for encoding
1-51, not used by default. Overrides quality
In kbps, the max bitrate fed to the decoder
encryption_method to use, e.g. aes-128
use a different key for each set of segments, rotating to a new key after this many segments
Forces a keyframe every X frames, but still allows additional keyframes — NOTE overrides keyframe_interval
Force the keyframe rate, h264 only, ignored if forced_keyframe_interval is used
video format, e.g. mp4, ts (for HLS), flv, m4f for video, png or jpg for images
frame rate in frames per second
number of bframes for h.264
h.264 profile level
h.264 profile
number of h.264 reference frames to use
Time segments optimized for HLS
Maximum number of frames between keyframes (default is 250, and overrides keyframe_rate)
Maximum number of keyframes per second
Image type for image renditions; required for image renditions
Whether this will be for live streaming video
Duration of stream to keep available for LiveDVR delivery (in seconds)
Maximum video bitrate (h.264 only)
Limits the frame rate rather than sets it, use as an alternative to frame rate
the media type of the rendition
force one-pass encoding
Creates a zip or tar file containing all the media files of an output, and uploads this single package rather than all the individual files
A reference id for the rendition that is unique within the account - required for DRM packaging
Set to true to skip video encoding for audio-only renditions
a target transcoding speed. Slower transcoding allows for more advanced file compression, while faster transcoding is possible by skipping some advanced compression features
Sets the format/protocol for an output that will be delivered using a specific streaming configuration, including necessary manifests, directory
Sets the profile of the streaming delivery format, ensuring options are selected for compatibility with the profile
transmuxing type for HLS; typical value is segmented
whether to upsize the frames if the source frame size is smaller than the target
target video bitrate in kbps
target video codec
target frame height in pixels
target frame width in pixels
array of watermark maps
URL for the watermark image
width in pixels or percent of frame width; e.g. 20 or 10%
height in pixels or percent of frame width; e.g. 20 or 10%
distance from left edge to center of image as pixels or precent of frame width; e.g. 20 or 10% (use negative values like -10 to position the watermark relative to the right edge)
distance from top edge to center if image as pixels or percent of frame height; e.g. 20 or 10% (use negative values like -10 to position the watermark relative to the bottom edge)
array of package maps for DRM (see Content Security)
for MPEG-DASH, array of DRM types to apply, e.g. ["widevine", "playready"]
for MPEG-DASH, the package type is dash; for other formats, the package type is the DRM type, e.g. widevine
for MPEG-DASH, the renditions will be set to the reference_id for a single rendition; for other formats, renditions is set equal to an array of rendition reference_id's

examples.title: Create Profile Example:
examples.content:
{
  "account_id": "57838016001",
  "name": "Protected",
  "description": "This will produce 1 HLS rendition and 2 image renditions.",
  "renditions": [
    {
      "media_type": "video",
      "reference_id": "ts1",
      "format": "ts",
      "type": "segmented",
      "audio_codec": "aac",
      "audio_bitrate": 96,
      "video_codec": "h264",
      "keyframe_rate": 0.5,
      "max_frame_rate": 30,
      "width": 1280,
      "height": 720,
      "h264_profile": "main",
      "watermarks": [
        {
          "width": "20%",
          "x": -10,
          "y": -20,
          "url": "http://learning-services-media.brightcove.com/images/bc_logo.png"
        }
      ]
    },
    {
      "media_type": "image",
      "format": "png",
      "label": "poster",
      "width": 960,
      "height": 540
    },
    {
      "media_type": "image",
      "format": "png",
      "label": "thumbnail",
      "width": 160,
      "height": 90
    }
  ],
  "digital_master": {
        "rendition": "passthrough",
        "distribute": true
    },
  "packages": []
}

Response Fields.description: profile id
profile name
when the profile was created (epoch time in milliseconds)
when the profile was last modified (epoch time in milliseconds)
Video Cloud account ID.
description of the profile
array of rendition maps
how to handle mismatch between source and rendition aspect ratio
audio bitrate in kbps
number of audio channels
the rendition id
audio codec, e.g. aac
whether to use constant bitrate for encoding
1-51, not used by default. Overrides quality
In kbps, the max bitrate fed to the decoder
encryption_method to use, e.g. aes-128
use a different key for each set of segments, rotating to a new key after this many segments
Forces a keyframe every X frames, but still allows additional keyframes
Force the keyframe rate, h264 only, ignored if forced_keyframe_interval is used
video format, e.g. mp4, ts (for HLS), flv, m4f for video, png or jpg for images
frame rate in frames per second
number of bframes for h.264
h.264 profile level
h.264 profile
number of h.264 reference frames to use
Time segments optimized for HLS
Maximum number of frames between keyframes (default is 250, and overrides keyframe_rate)
Maximum number of keyframes per second
Image type for image renditions; required for image renditions
Whether this will be for live streaming video
Duration of stream to keep available for LiveDVR delivery (in seconds)
Maximum video bitrate (h.264 only)
Limits the frame rate rather than sets it, use as an alternative to frame rate
the media type of the rendition
force one-pass encoding
Creates a zip or tar file containing all the media files of an output, and uploads this single package rather than all the individual files
A reference id for the rendition that is unique within the account - required for DRM packaging
Set to true to skip video encoding for audio-only renditions
a target transcoding speed. Slower transcoding allows for more advanced file compression, while faster transcoding is possible by skipping some advanced compression features
Sets the format/protocol for an output that will be delivered using a specific streaming configuration, including necessary manifests, directory
Sets the profile of the streaming delivery format, ensuring options are selected for compatibility with the profile
transmuxing type for HLS; typical value is segmented
whether to upsize the frames if the source frame size is smaller than the target
target video bitrate in kbps
target video codec
target frame height in pixels
target frame width in pixels
array of watermark maps
URL for the watermark image
width in pixels or percent of frame width; e.g. 20 or 10%
height in pixels or percent of frame width; e.g. 20 or 10%
distance from left edge to center of image as pixels or precent of frame width; e.g. 20 or 10%
distance from top edge to center if image as pixels or percent of frame height; e.g. 20 or 10%
array of package maps for DRM (see Content Security)
for MPEG-DASH, array of DRM types to apply, e.g. ["widevine", "playready"]
for MPEG-DASH, the package type is dash; for other formats, the package type is the DRM type, e.g. widevine
for MPEG-DASH, the renditions will be set to the reference_id for a single rendition; for other formats, renditions is set equal to an array of rendition reference_id's

examples.title: Success Response:
examples.content:
HTTP/1.1 201 Created
{
    "account_id": 57838016001,
    "brightcove_standard": false,
    "date_created": 1443700501852,
    "date_last_modified": 1443700501852,
    "description": "This will produce 1 HLS rendition and 2 image renditions.",
    "digital_master": {
        "distribute": true,
        "rendition": "passthrough"
    },
    "id": "560d1f15e4b05e8c5d7fa5c4",
    "keep_renditions": true,
    "name": "Protected",
    "packages": [],
    "renditions": [
        {
            "audio_bitrate": 96,
            "audio_codec": "aac",
            "format": "ts",
            "h264_profile": "main",
            "height": 720,
            "id": "560d1f15e4b05e8c5d7fa5c1",
            "keyframe_rate": 0.5,
            "max_frame_rate": 30.0,
            "media_type": "video",
            "reference_id": "ts1",
            "type": "segmented",
            "video_codec": "h264",
            "width": 1280
        },
        {
            "format": "png",
            "height": 540,
            "id": "560d1f15e4b05e8c5d7fa5c2",
            "label": "poster",
            "media_type": "image",
            "width": 960
        },
        {
            "format": "png",
            "height": 90,
            "id": "560d1f15e4b05e8c5d7fa5c3",
            "label": "thumbnail",
            "media_type": "image",
            "width": 160
        }
    ],
    "version": 1443700501853
}

Error 4xx.description: 400: Invalid JSON — message varies according to the problem
409: Could not create profile with this name and id (profile name or id already exists)
422: required field missing — message varies according to the issue
401: Credentials are required to access this resource.
404: Resource not found

examples.title: 400 Invalid JSON
examples.content:
HTTP/1.1 400 BAD_REQUEST Error 400 Unrecognized token 'true': was expecting 'null', 'true', 'false' or NaN

HTTP ERROR 400

Problem accessing /v1/accounts/57838016001/profiles. Reason: 

 Unrecognized token 'true': was expecting 'null', 'true', 'false' or NaN

examples.title: 400 BAD_REQUEST
examples.content:
HTTP/1.1 400 DUPLICATE REFERENCE_ID Error 400 rendition list contains duplicate reference ID: ts1 (through reference chain: com.brightcove.profiles.common.model.Profile["renditions"])

HTTP ERROR 400

Problem accessing /v1/accounts/57838016001/profiles. Reason: 

 rendition list contains duplicate reference ID: ts1 (through reference chain: com.brightcove.profiles.common.model.Profile["renditions"])

examples.title: 422 UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY
examples.content:
HTTP/1.1 422 UNPROCESSABLE_ENTITY Error 422 Unprocessable_Entity

HTTP ERROR 422

Problem accessing /v1/accounts/57838016001/profiles. Reason: 

 Unprocessable_Entity

The request entity had the following errors:

  • renditions[0].format may not be null (was null)

examples.content:

 NOT_FOUND

title: Update Ingest Profile
name: Update_Ingest_Profile
description: Update an existing ingest profile - the existing profile will be deactivated, and replaced by the one specified in the request body

Request Body Fields.description: profile name (must be unique within the account)
Video Cloud account ID.
description of the profile
array of rendition maps
how to handle mismatch between source and rendition aspect ratio
audio bitrate in kbps
number of audio channels
audio codec, e.g. aac
whether to use constant bitrate for encoding
1-51, not used by default. Overrides quality
In kbps, the max bitrate fed to the decoder
encryption_method to use, e.g. aes-128
use a different key for each set of segments, rotating to a new key after this many segments
Forces a keyframe every X frames, but still allows additional keyframes — NOTE overrides keyframe_interval
Force the keyframe rate, h264 only, ignored if forced_keyframe_interval is used
video format, e.g. mp4, ts (for HLS), flv, m4f for video, png or jpg for images
frame rate in frames per second
number of bframes for h.264
h.264 profile level
h.264 profile
number of h.264 reference frames to use
Time segments optimized for HLS
Maximum number of frames between keyframes (default is 250, and overrides keyframe_rate)
Maximum number of keyframes per second
Image type for image renditions; required for image renditions
Whether this will be for live streaming video
Duration of stream to keep available for LiveDVR delivery (in seconds)
Maximum video bitrate (h.264 only)
Limits the frame rate rather than sets it, use as an alternative to frame rate
the media type of the rendition
force one-pass encoding
Creates a zip or tar file containing all the media files of an output, and uploads this single package rather than all the individual files
A reference id for the rendition that is unique within the account - required for DRM packaging
Set to true to skip video encoding for audio-only renditions
a target transcoding speed. Slower transcoding allows for more advanced file compression, while faster transcoding is possible by skipping some advanced compression features
Sets the format/protocol for an output that will be delivered using a specific streaming configuration, including necessary manifests, directory
Sets the profile of the streaming delivery format, ensuring options are selected for compatibility with the profile
transmuxing type for HLS; typical value is segmented
whether to upsize the frames if the source frame size is smaller than the target
target video bitrate in kbps
target video codec
target frame height in pixels
target frame width in pixels
array of watermark maps
URL for the watermark image
width in pixels or percent of frame width; e.g. 20 or 10%
height in pixels or percent of frame width; e.g. 20 or 10%
distance from left edge to center of image as pixels or precent of frame width; e.g. 20 or 10%
distance from top edge to center if image as pixels or percent of frame height; e.g. 20 or 10%
array of package maps for DRM (see Content Security)
for MPEG-DASH, array of DRM types to apply, e.g. ["widevine", "playready"]
for MPEG-DASH, the package type is dash; for other formats, the package type is the DRM type, e.g. widevine
for MPEG-DASH, the renditions will be set to the reference_id for a single rendition; for other formats, renditions is set equal to an array of rendition reference_id's

examples.title: Update Profile Example:
examples.content:
{
  "account_id": "57838016001",
  "name": "Protected",
  "description": "This will produce 1 HLS rendition and 2 image renditions.",
  "renditions": [
    {
      "media_type": "video",
      "reference_id": "ts1",
      "format": "ts",
      "type": "segmented",
      "audio_codec": "aac",
      "audio_bitrate": 96,
      "video_codec": "h264",
      "keyframe_rate": 0.5,
      "max_frame_rate": 30,
      "width": 1280,
      "height": 720,
      "h264_profile": "main"
    },
    {
      "media_type": "image",
      "format": "png",
      "label": "poster",
      "width": 960,
      "height": 540
    },
    {
      "media_type": "image",
      "format": "png",
      "label": "thumbnail",
      "width": 160,
      "height": 90
    }
  ],
  "digital_master": {
        "rendition": "passthrough",
        "distribute": true
    },
  "packages": []
}

Error 4xx.description: 400: Invalid JSON — message varies according to the problem
409: Could not create profile with this name and id (profile name or id already exists)
422: required field missing — message varies according to the issue
401: Credentials are required to access this resource.
404: Resource not found
